study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of spectral iodine maps in detecting cardiac thrombi, particularly in the left atrial appendage, during acute ischemic stroke assessment.
results_summary: The study found that extending stroke CTA to cover the heart increased detection of cardiac thrombi, with spectral iodine maps providing additional value for identifying left atrial appendage thrombus.
population_specificity: Patients with transient ischemic attack or acute ischemic stroke who had assessable nongated head-to-heart CTA at the University Medical Center Utrecht.

study_goal: The researchers compared the efficacy and safety of iodine-125 brachytherapy to cesium-131 brachytherapy for treating brain metastases.
results_summary: The study found that iodine-125 brachytherapy has declined in use due to unfavorable rates of radiation necrosis without survival improvement, while cesium-131 demonstrated better locoregional tumor control and lower risks of radiation necrosis.
population_specificity: Patients with brain metastases undergoing surgical resection.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the role of miRNAs in thyroid cancer (TC), including their influence on resistance to treatments like radioactive iodine.
results_summary: The study found that miRNAs play a significant role in regulating genes and signaling pathways involved in TC progression and resistance to therapies, including radioactive iodine. They may serve as diagnostic or prognostic tools for TC.
population_specificity: Thyroid cancer patients (specific subtypes: Papillary thyroid cancer and Follicular thyroid carcinoma).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether the severity of signs and symptoms and time to viral clearance in adenoviral conjunctivitis were correlated with conjunctival viral titers, using a single in-office administration of ophthalmic 5% povidone-iodine.
results_summary: Higher viral titers were strongly correlated with more severe symptoms and clinical signs, as well as longer time to viral clearance. Symptoms and signs persisted in approximately half of the eyes even after viral clearance.
population_specificity: 28 participants with quantitative polymerase chain reaction-confirmed adenoviral conjunctivitis.
effective_dosage: Single in-office administration of ophthalmic 5% povidone-iodine.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the histopathologic findings, molecular pathology, clinical implications, management, and prognosis of thyroid carcinomas originating in struma ovarii, particularly focusing on the role of iodine in treatment.
results_summary: The study found that thyroid carcinoma in struma ovarii is rare, with papillary thyroid carcinoma being the most common type. Treatment involves surgery, with consideration of total thyroidectomy and radioactive iodine ablation for high-risk cases or disease spread beyond the ovary.
population_specificity: Patients with thyroid carcinoma originating in struma ovarii.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the clinical utility, efficacy, and limitations of non-thionamide anti-thyroid drugs, including iodine compounds, for controlling Graves' hyperthyroidism.
results_summary: The abstract mentions iodine compounds as historical non-thionamide agents that act on thyroid hormone synthesis, release, or metabolism, but specific efficacy data for iodine alone are not detailed.
population_specificity: Patients with Graves' hyperthyroidism who are intolerant or unresponsive to thionamides.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the histologic changes in the thyroid gland induced by iodine and other drug classes.
results_summary: Radioactive iodine initially causes mild histologic changes, but long-term effects include follicular atrophy, fibrosis, and nuclear atypia, varying with the gland's pre-therapy condition.
population_specificity: Not specified (general review of drug effects on thyroid pathology).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the clinical effectiveness and economic impact of iodine-impregnated incise drapes for preventing surgical site infections.
results_summary: The study found that iodine-impregnated drapes in cardiac surgery patients may reduce infections and provide cost-savings, with estimated savings of £549 per patient in deterministic analysis. However, further research is required.
population_specificity: Cardiac surgery patients

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of a standard healing protocol using povidone iodine gel versus an experimental protocol using hyaluronic acid cream in post-operative recovery after phenol technique surgery for ingrown toenail.
results_summary: The study found that the standard protocol with povidone iodine gel resulted in a longer healing time (26.17 days) compared to the hyaluronic acid protocol (22.42 days), but there were no significant differences in bleeding or perceived pain between the two groups.
population_specificity: 70 patients who underwent phenol technique surgery for ingrown toenail.
effective_dosage: Not specified (standard protocol with povidone iodine gel).
study_duration: Post-operative cures were administered over the healing period (26.17 days for control, 22.42 days for experimental).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the challenges and approaches in diagnosing, staging, and managing thyroid cancer during pregnancy, with a focus on imaging and treatment options.
results_summary: The abstract highlights that radioactive iodine is contraindicated in pregnancy due to risks to the fetus, and surgical interventions also pose risks. It discusses imaging modalities (CT, MRI, nuclear imaging, ultrasound, FNA) and emphasizes the need for careful management and surveillance.
population_specificity: Pregnant individuals with thyroid cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of mobile robots in monitoring vital signs and radiation dose rates for patients receiving radionuclide 131I therapy.
results_summary: The study found that mobile robots achieved 100% consistency, completion rate, and first success rate in monitoring vital signs and radiation doses, demonstrating good effectiveness and safety. No adverse events related to the robots were reported.
population_specificity: 72 participants (median age 39.5; 37.5% male) receiving radionuclide 131I therapy at three medical centers in China.
study_duration: The trial was conducted from 1 April 2018 to 1 September 2018.

study_goal: The researchers were attempting to characterize the prognosis and pathological features of poorly differentiated thyroid carcinoma (PDTC) and high-grade differentiated thyroid carcinoma (HGDTC).
results_summary: The study found that PDTC and HGDTC share features such as invasion, thyroid follicular-cell origin, and tumor necrosis or increased mitoses, with prognoses intermediate between well-differentiated and anaplastic thyroid carcinoma.
population_specificity: Patients with poorly differentiated thyroid carcinoma (PDTC) and high-grade differentiated thyroid carcinoma (HGDTC).

study_goal: The researchers compared the effectiveness of chlorhexidine gluconate plus alcohol-based skin preparation versus povidone iodine plus alcohol in reducing surgical site infections.
results_summary: The study found that chlorhexidine gluconate plus alcohol-based skin preparation resulted in a lower infection rate (4.0%) compared to povidone iodine plus alcohol (6.5%). This suggests that iodine-based preparations may be less effective than chlorhexidine for surgical site antisepsis.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing surgery, particularly those at risk for surgical site infections.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the safety, efficacy, and clinical outcomes of recombinant human TSH (rhTSH) versus thyroid hormone withdrawal (THW) for TSH stimulation in patients undergoing radioiodine therapy for differentiated thyroid carcinoma.
results_summary: The study found that rhTSH avoids transient hypothyroidism-related side effects (e.g., nausea, fatigue) and faster radioiodine excretion compared to THW, with similar remnant ablation rates. However, insufficient trials exist for adjuvant therapy and treatment of known disease, warranting further research.
population_specificity: Patients with differentiated thyroid carcinoma (DTC) undergoing radioiodine therapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of background medications, including antithyroid drugs, lithium, prednisone, and glycididazole sodium, on the efficacy of radioactive iodine (RAI) therapy in patients with thyroid cancer and hyperthyroidism.
results_summary: Antithyroid drugs were associated with negative impacts on post-RAI outcomes, while lithium, prednisone, and glycididazole sodium appeared to have positive effects. The study highlighted a lack of research on non-thyroid medications affecting RAI therapy.
population_specificity: Patients with thyroid cancer and hyperthyroidism (3313 participants across 17 studies).
interactions: Antithyroid drugs (negative impact), lithium, prednisone, and glycididazole sodium (positive impact).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and toxicity of radioactive Iodine-125 seed implantation for treating lymph node recurrence in esophageal cancer patients after external radiotherapy.
results_summary: The study found that Iodine-125 seed implantation showed efficacy with 29.4% complete response and 40.5% partial response rates, but 61.1% of patients experienced skin reactions, including 5.6% with severe toxicity. The 1-, 2-, and 3-year survival rates were 80.2%, 38.8%, and 24.5%, respectively.
population_specificity: Patients with lymph node recurrence of esophageal cancer after external radiotherapy (n=126).
effective_dosage: Not specified (target volume ranged from 2.1-128.1 cm³).
study_duration: Not specified (retrospective study covering January 2016 to March 2019).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of pretreatment with methimazole before radioactive iodine administration versus radioactive iodine alone for treating Graves' disease.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in the risk of persistent hyperthyroidism between the combination therapy (methimazole + radioactive iodine) and radioactive iodine alone. Subgroup analysis suggested a non-significant trend toward lower risk when methimazole was discontinued within 7 days before radioactive iodine use.
population_specificity: Patients with Graves' disease (297 participants across 5 studies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether adjuvant radioiodine (RAI) therapy after reoperation improves outcomes in patients with persistent or recurrent differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC).
results_summary: Adjuvant RAI after reoperation in recurrent DTC was not associated with improved progression-free or overall survival, treatment response, or reduced recurrence/metastases. The included studies were of inadequate quality, highlighting the need for better-designed trials.
population_specificity: Patients of any age with persistent or recurrent differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC) who underwent reoperation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether the minimum bactericidal concentration (MBC) of povidone-iodine (PVI) has changed over time in microbes relevant to surgical site infections (SSIs).
results_summary: The study found insufficient data for meta-analysis of PVI, so no conclusions could be drawn about changes in its MBC over time. However, for chlorhexidine (CHX), no evidence of reduced susceptibility in common SSI-causing microbes was found.
population_specificity: Laboratory and clinical isolates of common microbes relevant to SSIs.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare guidelines on maternal obesity management, including discrepancies in iodine supplementation recommendations.
results_summary: The study identified discrepancies among guidelines regarding iodine supplementation for obese pregnant women, but no specific effects or outcomes of iodine were detailed.
population_specificity: Obese pregnant women and those with previous bariatric surgery.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of a multifaceted infection control approach (including nasal povidone iodine) versus single interventions in reducing surgical site infections.
results_summary: The multifaceted approach reduced surgical site infections by 68% compared to single interventions, and infections detected increased 2.61-fold with ≥60-day follow-up versus 30-day follow-up.
population_specificity: Surgical patients in operating rooms (4865 patients across four studies).
study_duration: Follow-up periods of 30 days and ≥60 days for infection detection.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the clinical course and management of iodine contrast-induced sialadenitis (CIS) and assess whether its incidence is underestimated.
results_summary: The study identified 4 cases of CIS detected by ENT physicians, presenting as bilateral submandibular gland swelling 12-72 hours after iodine contrast exposure. The condition was self-limited, resolving within 60-150 hours, and characteristic ultrasonographic findings supported the diagnosis.
population_specificity: Patients aged 68-76 years admitted to the emergency room with clinical and radiological features of CIS.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the efficacy and toxicity of combination treatment with iodine 125 seeds implant and systemic therapy versus systemic therapy alone in patients with non-small-cell lung cancer (NSCLC).
results_summary: The study found that combination treatment significantly improved clinical response (CR, PR, ORR, DCR, two-year OS) and reduced SD and PD compared to systemic therapy alone, though it increased the incidence of pneumothorax without affecting myelosuppression or gastrointestinal symptoms.
population_specificity: Patients with non-small-cell lung cancer (NSCLC).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review existing literature on highly differentiated follicular carcinoma of ovarian origin (HDFCO) associated with struma ovarii to understand its pathophysiology, treatment, and prognosis, including the role of radioactive iodine therapy.
results_summary: The study identified 20 HDFCO cases, noting that combined thyroidectomy/radioactive iodine therapy was used in 62.5% of cases, with one recurrence but no disease-related morbidity reported. The rarity of HDFCO limits definitive conclusions, but standard treatment appears to offer a favorable prognosis in selected cases.
population_specificity: Patients with highly differentiated follicular carcinoma of ovarian origin (HDFCO), aged 24-74 years.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether 1% povidone-iodine mouth rinse reduces salivary SARS-CoV-2 viral load in COVID-19 patients compared to other rinses and controls.
results_summary: Povidone-iodine showed a significant reduction in viral load at 60 minutes compared to the no-rinse group, though the reduction was not statistically significant over time within its own group. The effect was similar to other active rinses and even the distilled water control, suggesting mechanical washing may contribute.
population_specificity: COVID-19 patients
study_duration: Immediate effects measured at 5, 30, and 60 minutes post-rinsing

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of 10% w/w Povidone-Iodine ointment with other treatments in preventing revision surgery for patients with mucormycosis (CAM).
results_summary: The study found that Povidone-Iodine had a lower risk of revision surgery compared to the control (saline), but the difference was not statistically significant (p > 0.05). It was less effective than Liposomal Amphotericin-B gel, which showed significant reduction in revision surgery.
population_specificity: Patients with microbiologically and histologically proven mucormycosis who underwent surgical debridement.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether intraoperative wound irrigation with aqueous povidone-iodine (PVP-I) was superior to saline in reducing surgical site infections (SSI) in clean-contaminated wounds after gastroenterological surgery.
results_summary: The study found no significant reduction in SSI incidence with PVP-I (7.6%) compared to saline (5.1%), with a risk difference of 0.025 (95% CI -0.006 to 0.056) and P=0.154, suggesting PVP-I was not superior to saline. The authors concluded that current recommendations for PVP-I use should be reconsidered.
population_specificity: Patients aged 20 years or older undergoing clean-contaminated gastroenterological surgery at a single institute in Japan.
effective_dosage: 40 mL of aqueous 10% PVP-I applied for 1 minute before skin closure.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of strict versus flexible restricted-iodine diets (RID) in reducing the body's iodine pool before radioiodine therapy (RAIT) in iodine-deficient regions.
results_summary: Both strict and flexible RID protocols effectively reduced the body's iodine pool, with no significant difference between the two groups in urinary iodine excretion. The flexible RID was found to be a viable option as it minimally disrupted patients' quality of life.
population_specificity: 144 patients (47 males, 97 females) with a mean age of 45 years, preparing for RAIT in an iodine-deficient region.
effective_dosage: Not specified (dietary iodine restriction protocols compared).

study_goal: The researchers evaluated the effectiveness of India's salt iodization program and discussed concerns about fortification-based interventions for addressing micronutrient deficiencies.
results_summary: The study found that despite decades of salt iodization programs, micronutrient deficiencies, including iodine deficiency, remain widespread in India, suggesting limited efficacy of fortification alone. It advocates for dietary diversification as a more sustainable long-term strategy.
population_specificity: General population in India, particularly those affected by micronutrient deficiencies.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review locoregional treatment options for patients with radioactive iodine-refractory differentiated thyroid carcinomas (RAIR DTCs) to delay systemic therapy.
results_summary: The study found that various radiation therapy and interventional radiology techniques can control metastatic spread, but optimal treatment selection requires multidisciplinary decision-making due to lack of comparative clinical trials.
population_specificity: Patients with slowly progressive and/or symptomatic oligometastatic RAIR differentiated thyroid carcinomas (DTCs).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of povidone iodine (PI) lavage in combination with vancomycin powder (VP) for preventing periprosthetic joint infection (PJI) in hip and knee arthroplasties.
results_summary: The combination of VP and PI lavage showed a lower risk of PJI in acute and high-risk hip and knee arthroplasty patients, with minimal or no serious adverse events, while VP-only use was associated with increased PJI rates and aseptic wound complications.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing primary or revision total joint arthroplasty (hip and knee), particularly elderly patients with comorbidities.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of various treatment strategies, including iodine-131 tositumomab, for relapsed/refractory diffuse large B-cell lymphoma (r/rDLBCL).
results_summary: The study found that iodine-131 tositumomab in association with BEAM sequential ASCT showed better efficacy, with a median overall survival of 25.8 months. Association therapies generally outperformed monotherapies in terms of survival and response rates.
population_specificity: Patients with relapsed/refractory diffuse large B-cell lymphoma (r/rDLBCL).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if preoperative vaginal cleansing with 1% povidone-iodine reduces postoperative infectious morbidity in women undergoing cesarean delivery after labor.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in infectious morbidity between the vaginal cleansing group and the control group, indicating povidone-iodine did not reduce postoperative infections. Secondary outcomes also showed no significant differences.
population_specificity: Women undergoing unscheduled cesarean delivery after labor (regular contractions, cervical dilation, or rupture of membranes).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review treatment and management strategies for hyperthyroidism and hypothyroidism, including iodine radiotherapy, and summarize the latest research on their metabolic mechanisms.
results_summary: The study highlights iodine radiotherapy as a traditional treatment for hyperthyroidism but does not provide specific efficacy data. It emphasizes the need for careful monitoring to avoid under- or over-treatment, which can lead to adverse outcomes.
population_specificity: Patients with hyperthyroidism and hypothyroidism (general population, including older people and pregnant women).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to document the historical understanding and clinical applications of iodine in treating thyroid-related conditions, including goiter and hypothyroidism.
results_summary: The study highlights iodine's role in preventing endemic goiter and eradicating cretinism, as well as its historical use in thyroid treatments, demonstrating significant clinical benefits over time.
population_specificity: Historical and clinical populations with thyroid disorders, including those with goiter, hypothyroidism, and congenital hypothyroidism.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to unify diagnostic and treatment criteria for thyroid dysfunction, including iodine nutrition, in pregnant women.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific findings on iodine's effects but highlights the need for standardized guidelines for thyroid function management during pregnancy.
population_specificity: Pregnant women with thyroid function disorders.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether gargling with povidone-iodine (PVP-I) could hasten viral clearance and reduce saliva infectivity in asymptomatic-to-mild COVID-19 patients.
results_summary: The study found that early PVP-I gargling significantly increased the RT-qPCR negative rate and infectivity clearance rate compared to the late group, suggesting PVP-I may accelerate virus clearance and reduce transmission. Only one participant reported oropharyngeal discomfort during the intervention.
population_specificity: Adolescents and adults with asymptomatic-to-mild COVID-19 in quarantine facilities in Osaka, Japan.
effective_dosage: Not specified (frequency implied as daily from days 2 to 6 for the early group).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the cardiovascular outcomes of different treatment modalities (antithyroid medications, radioactive iodine ablation, and surgery) for Graves' disease.
results_summary: Surgery was found to be superior in reducing the risk of arrhythmia (81%) and congestive heart failure (80%) compared to antithyroid medications and radioactive iodine. Radioactive iodine showed the least reduction in CHF risk (7%).
population_specificity: 6,700 patients with Graves' disease (74% female, mean age 44.34 years).

study_goal: The researchers were examining the historical understanding of thyroid dysfunction and its clinical consequences, including goitre and cretinism.
results_summary: The abstract describes the historical recognition of thyroid dysfunction and its severe consequences but does not provide specific findings about iodine's effects.
population_specificity: Not specified in the abstract.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential link between iodine status and DNA methylation patterns in autoimmune thyroid disease (AITD) patients.
results_summary: The study found that DNA methylation patterns in certain genes (ITGA6, PRKAA2, DAPK1) differed between AITD patients from regions with varying iodine status, suggesting a potential mechanism for iodine's association with AITD. However, findings await replication and lack functional validation.
population_specificity: Patients with autoimmune thyroid disease (Graves disease and Hashimoto disease).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the similarities and differences between pediatric and adult thyroid cancers, focusing on genetic drivers, treatment approaches, and the role of radioactive iodine therapy.
results_summary: Pediatric thyroid cancer, despite frequent metastasis, has an excellent prognosis. Treatment decisions must balance morbidity and benefits, particularly regarding total thyroidectomy vs. lobectomy and radioactive iodine therapy. Molecular therapies targeting genetic drivers show promise for progressive, radioiodine-refractory disease.
population_specificity: Children with thyroid cancer

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of povidone-iodine (PVI) versus normal saline (NS) for preventing surgical site infections (SSI) after gastrectomy and identify risk factors for SSI.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in SSI rates between PVI and NS groups, with both showing similar efficacy. High BMI and postoperative complications were identified as independent risk factors for SSI.
population_specificity: 340 patients with gastric cancer undergoing gastrectomy.

study_goal: The researchers compared the effectiveness and safety of long-term methimazole (LT-MMI) versus radioactive iodine (RAI) in achieving sustained control of hyperthyroidism in patients with toxic multinodular goiter (TMNG).
results_summary: LT-MMI therapy achieved euthyroidism faster (4.3 months vs. 16.3 months) and maintained it longer (95.8% vs. 72.4% of the study period) compared to RAI, with no major adverse events reported in either group.
population_specificity: 130 untreated patients with toxic multinodular goiter (TMNG).
study_duration: 108 to 148 months (median 120 months for LT-MMI, 132 months for RAI).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review controversies and decision-making challenges in the management of low-risk differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC), including the role of radioactive iodine (RAI) treatment.
results_summary: The study highlights evolving recommendations for DTC management, noting that treatment options range from active surveillance to total thyroidectomy with RAI in select cases, emphasizing personalized approaches.
population_specificity: Patients with low-risk differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the impact of nutrition-focused social marketing campaigns and modified fishing traps on improving fish consumption and nutritional status, including iodine, in small-scale fisher households.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific results regarding iodine's effects, as the study is described in terms of its design and intervention approach rather than outcomes.
population_specificity: Small-scale fisher households in Kilifi County, Kenya, including mothers, caregivers, children aged 6-60 months, and fishers.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the global effort to eliminate iodine deficiency and its impact on public health, focusing on the effectiveness of salt iodisation programs.
results_summary: The study found that global iodised salt programs have significantly improved iodine intake, with 88% of the global population using iodised salt by 2018. This intervention has led to improved cognitive development in children and an estimated global economic benefit of $33 billion.
population_specificity: Global population, with a focus on low- and middle-income countries.

study_goal: The researchers were examining the relationship between vitamin A/retinoids and thyroid gland metabolism, including potential interactions with iodine deficiency.
results_summary: The abstract suggests vitamin A deficiency is correlated with thyroid gland impairment and often coexists with iodine deficiency, but no direct findings on iodine's effects are reported.
population_specificity: Not specified in the abstract.

study_goal: The researchers reported a rare case of coexisting papillary thyroid cancer and esophageal squamous cell carcinoma, with incidental findings during thyroidectomy.
results_summary: The study described a successful surgical and postoperative treatment approach for both cancers, including radioactive iodine therapy, with acceptable outcomes after two years of follow-up.
population_specificity: A 45-year-old female with papillary thyroid cancer and esophageal squamous cell carcinoma.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of iodine treatment in managing autonomous thyroid nodules.
results_summary: The consensus highlights iodine's role in diagnosing and treating autonomous thyroid nodules, emphasizing multidisciplinary collaboration for optimal outcomes. No specific efficacy metrics are provided, but the consensus supports its use in clinical practice.
population_specificity: Patients with thyroid nodules, particularly those with autonomous or malignant nodules.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether povidone iodine (PI) diluted sitz baths could reduce perianal infection incidence in chemotherapy patients with hematological malignancies and identify the optimal concentration.
results_summary: The study hypothesized that PI sitz baths would benefit patients, but results were not yet reported as the trial was ongoing at the time of the abstract. Secondary endpoints included bacterial culture results, infection severity, adverse events, and pain scores.
population_specificity: Patients with hematological malignancies undergoing chemotherapy and at risk for perianal infection.
effective_dosage: 1:100, 1:200, and 1:300 PI dilutions for sitz baths.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of photon-counting detector computed tomography (PCD CT) to improve iodine distribution quantification and imaging compared to conventional CT.
results_summary: PCD CT demonstrated superior spatial- and contrast resolution for soft tissues, reduced artifacts, and better X-ray photon energy separation, enhancing iodine distribution quantification and K-edge imaging. The technology may improve clinical applicability, though further advancements in image reconstruction are possible.
population_specificity: Not specified (general applicability to medical imaging)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the efficacy of mouth rinses and nasal sprays, potentially including iodine, in reducing the salivary viral load of SARS-CoV-2.
results_summary: The abstract does not specify results related to iodine, focusing instead on a broader review of mouth rinses and nasal sprays for SARS-CoV-2 viral load reduction.
population_specificity: Not specified in the abstract.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to clarify the need for iodine supplementation during pregnancy in areas with mild-moderate deficiency by reviewing meta-analyses on maternal and neonatal outcomes.
results_summary: The study found a U-shaped correlation between iodine status and maternal/neonatal outcomes, but intervention trials in mild-moderate deficiency areas showed inconclusive benefits. Meta-analyses highlighted variability due to factors like iodine deficiency severity and study heterogeneity.
population_specificity: Pregnant women in areas with mild-moderate iodine deficiency.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of aqueous 10% povidone-iodine versus aqueous 4% chlorhexidine gluconate in preventing surgical site infections in patients with open fractures.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in surgical site infection rates between the povidone-iodine (7%) and chlorhexidine gluconate (7%) groups, suggesting both are equally effective for skin antisepsis in open fracture surgery. The choice between the two can be based on availability, patient contraindications, or cost.
population_specificity: Adults aged 18 or older with open extremity fractures requiring surgical fixation and debridement within 72 hours of injury.
effective_dosage: Aqueous 10% povidone-iodine applied immediately before surgical incision.
study_duration: Single application at the time of surgery.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify clinical conditions associated with thymic uptake on I-131 post-therapeutic scans in thyroid cancer patients.
results_summary: Thymic uptake was more common in younger patients and those with a history of repeated radioactive iodine (RAI) therapy. Structural recurrence was more frequent in the positive thymic uptake group, while biochemical recurrence was higher in the negative group.
population_specificity: 685 thyroid cancer patients who received I-131 therapy.
study_duration: Retrospective study covering scans obtained between January 2010 and December 2010.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the analgesic effect and safety of celiac plexus neurolysis using ethanol injection combined with iodine-125 for refractory abdominal cancer pain.
results_summary: The study found that combining ethanol injection with iodine-125 significantly reduced pain scores (NRS) and analgesic drug intake, with no significant recurrence in the iodine group compared to the control group. No major complications or treatment-related deaths were reported.
population_specificity: Patients with severe refractory abdominal cancer pain (n=10).
study_duration: Follow-up period included assessments at 24 hours and 1 month postprocedure.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the current and potential roles of povidone-iodine as an antiseptic in nursing home infection management, focusing on MRSA decolonization, chronic wound care, and oral hygiene.
results_summary: Povidone-iodine demonstrated a broader spectrum of antimicrobial activity, rapid and potent efficacy against MRSA and other microbes in chronic wounds, and superior performance in oral care compared to other antiseptics like chlorhexidine. It also showed rapid in-vitro virucidal activity against SARS-CoV-2 and no reported bacterial resistance.
population_specificity: Nursing home residents, particularly those requiring infection management for MRSA, chronic wounds, or oral care.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential synergistic effects of combining multikinase inhibitors (MKIs)/lenvatinib with radioactive iodine (RAI) in RAI-refractory differentiated thyroid cancer.
results_summary: The abstract suggests that combining MKIs/lenvatinib with RAI may improve efficacy and reduce toxicity compared to either treatment alone, supported by early preclinical data, but clinical validation is pending ongoing trials.
population_specificity: Patients with RAI-refractory differentiated thyroid cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the outcomes and safety of completion thyroidectomy versus initial lobectomy in patients with differentiated thyroid cancer, focusing on factors like pain, hospital stay, and residual malignancy.
results_summary: Completion thyroidectomy was found to be as safe as initial lobectomy, with no differences in operating time, blood loss, or hospital stay, but patients reported higher pain scores postoperatively. Multifocality was the only predictor for residual malignancy in the contralateral lobe.
population_specificity: 61 consecutive patients who underwent initial lobectomy and subsequent completion thyroidectomy for differentiated thyroid cancer (2012-2021).

study_goal: The researchers compared the efficacy and safety of acacia nilotica paste versus povidone iodine solution as a primary non-surgical treatment for omphalocele major.
results_summary: Patients treated with acacia nilotica paste showed faster full oral feeding tolerance, shorter hospital stays, and lower mortality rates compared to those treated with povidone iodine solution.
population_specificity: 20 cases of omphalocele major in pediatric patients (excluded gastroschisis, ruptured omphalocele major, or omphalocele minor).
study_duration: July 2016 to June 2019 (study duration; intervention length not specified)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review recent progress in cluster-based crystalline materials for the targeted and efficient capture of radioactive iodine in nuclear waste.
results_summary: The study highlights that cluster-based crystalline materials, including molecular clusters and metal-organic frameworks, show promise for iodine capture due to their tunable structures, binding sites, and modifications. Design strategies and potential capture mechanisms are discussed to improve iodine affinity.
population_specificity: Not applicable (materials science research)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the advantages of spectral CT, particularly iodine-map images, for detecting and characterizing oncologic lesions and assessing treatment response.
results_summary: Spectral CT, especially iodine-map images, improved detection and characterization of oncologic lesions and may serve as a biomarker for treatment response. The combination of virtual unenhanced and low monoenergetic images enhanced tumor vascularization assessment.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing oncologic imaging (specific demographics not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the molecular mechanisms of dedifferentiated thyroid cancer and explore novel radionuclide tracers and drugs for early diagnosis and treatment.
results_summary: The study summarized updated molecular mechanisms of dedifferentiation and highlighted the potential of molecular modification-based imaging for accurate diagnosis and novel therapeutics in dedifferentiated thyroid cancer.
population_specificity: Patients with dedifferentiated thyroid cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review key factors for planning radioactive iodine therapy in differentiated thyroid cancer patients post-surgery and during follow-up.
results_summary: The study highlights radioactive iodine therapy as a critical treatment for differentiated thyroid cancer, used based on recurrence risk and mortality according to AJCC/TNM staging and ATA risk stratification. It emphasizes selective application in specific cases.
population_specificity: Differentiated thyroid cancer patients post-surgery.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the appropriate resection margin for early tongue cancer and investigate the need for additional treatment for close margins and stump dysplasia, with iodine staining as one of the variables examined.
results_summary: The study found that iodine staining was one of the variables investigated, but no specific results regarding its effects were highlighted in the abstract. The focus was on margin distances and their correlation with local recurrence.
population_specificity: 564 patients with early tongue cancer from ten hospitals.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of 10% povidone iodine (PVI) as a chemical disinfectant on micro-shear bond strength (µSBS) and microhardness of resin-infiltrated human dentin.
results_summary: The study found that 10% PVI surface treatment resulted in a substantial reduction in µSBS between composite and dentin, indicating it negatively impacted bonding effectiveness. No significant effects on microhardness were reported for PVI.
population_specificity: Caries-free intact permanent third molar teeth (human dentin samples).
study_duration: Not specified (intervention duration not mentioned in the abstract).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review treatments and methodologies for achieving a euthyroid state in patients with thyroid storm prior to definitive therapy, including radioactive iodine ablation.
results_summary: The abstract highlights the diagnostic criteria for thyroid storm and emphasizes the importance of achieving a euthyroid state before definitive treatments like radioactive iodine ablation or thyroidectomy to minimize complications. It does not provide specific efficacy data for iodine but underscores its role in treatment protocols.
population_specificity: Patients with thyroid storm, particularly those with Graves' disease as the underlying etiology.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize recent evidence on the clinical applications of iodine-123 metaiodobenzylguanidine in assessing myocardial sympathetic innervation function for prognosis in heart failure patients.
results_summary: The study found that comorbidities and chronic conditions worsen sympathetic nervous system impairment in heart failure patients, negatively impacting disease progression and outcomes. Cardiac imaging with iodine-123 metaiodobenzylguanidine was highlighted as a tool for assessing this impairment.
population_specificity: Patients with heart failure.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of 10% povidone-iodine versus 4% chlorhexidine in reducing surgical site infections after open fracture surgery.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide results on the comparative efficacy of povidone-iodine versus chlorhexidine, as it describes the study protocol and statistical analysis plan rather than outcomes.
population_specificity: Patients with surgically treated open fractures at 14 participating sites.
study_duration: Intervention periods were 2 months per cluster, with follow-up for infections lasting 30-90 days post-surgery.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to systematically review the effectiveness of non-pharmacological and pharmacological interventions in preventing radioactive iodine (RAI)-induced salivary gland dysfunction in patients with differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC).
results_summary: Non-pharmacological treatments (e.g., parotid gland massage, aromatherapy) and certain antioxidants (vitamin E, selenium) showed benefits in reducing RAI-induced salivary gland dysfunction, while other interventions (vitamin C, pilocarpine) did not demonstrate significant effects. Amifostine and bethanechol had mixed or inconsistent outcomes.
population_specificity: Adults (>18 years) with DTC who underwent RAI therapy after thyroidectomy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the diagnostic accuracy of radioactive iodine seed placement in the axilla (RISAS) for detecting residual disease after neoadjuvant chemotherapy in patients with node-positive breast cancer.
results_summary: The RISAS procedure showed high identification rates (98.2%), low false-negative rates (3.5%), and high negative predictive values (92.8%), outperforming SLNB and MARI procedures in accuracy. It was deemed the most feasible and accurate less-invasive method for axillary staging post-neoadjuvant chemotherapy.
population_specificity: Patients with initially clinically node-positive (cN+) breast cancer (cT1-4, cN1-3b) treated with neoadjuvant chemotherapy.
study_duration: Intervention duration not explicitly stated; data collection spanned from March 2017 to December 2019.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of radioactive iodine (RAI) and iodine-based imaging techniques in the diagnosis, staging, and treatment of differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC).
results_summary: The study found that radioactive iodine-131 (RAI) is effective for intermediate-high risk DTC, with potential for personalized dosimetry and retreatment. Iodine-124 PET/CT shows promise for staging and dosimetry, while F18-FDG PET/CT is useful for high-risk DTC and noniodine-avid recurrences.
population_specificity: Patients with differentiated thyroid cancer (DTC), poorly differentiated thyroid cancer, anaplastic thyroid cancer, and medullary thyroid cancer.
